channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sunken works, 6th December
item.description:
Recently repaired area after (gas?) works. Not properly refilled. Seems to be sinking rapidly and will become a substantial pothole and hazard shortly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Lower Court Farm Church Road, Staverton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 street lights in the entrance of Zura Avenue that are not working., 6th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 36 Zura Avenue, Brockworth

item.title: Elmbridge Court roundabout road markings and on road signage, 6th December
item.description:
Urgent. There has been three accidents in the past week and another today. The road markings and road signs have worn so badly they cannot be seen very clearly in the dark and virtually invisible when wet and that’s in the day. The lanes are so important to this roundabout with its hamburger flyover we are shocked this has not been dealt with before the winter. The Lane lines and road signage needs to be repainted immediately, please look into this urgently. I could not take photos as it’s too dangerous. I have sent this to my MP to follow up as a matter of safety urgency. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elm Bridge Court, Longlevens
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Conditional Sign Missing, 4th December
item.description:

item.title: Abandoned vehicle on Leighton Road, 4th December
item.description:
This vehicle has been left on Leighton Road since early September. The vehicle has some significant damage to the front left area, which presumably is the result of a road traffic collision. The vehicle is taking up badly needed parking space for residents, but more pertinently appears to have been dumped as no one has been to it since it was left here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 37 Leighton Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 60 Edinburgh Place, Cheltenham

item.title: Tyres and gas pipes have been fly tipped, 2nd December

item.title: Dead tree hanging over the road, 2nd December
item.description:
The location is the left hand side of Mill Lane going towards Glenfall Hotel. A tree was hit by a van and part of it fell into the road and was moved aside. However, the remainder is hanging a bit precariously over the road and could come down anytime and especially if clipped again by a high side vehicle. Please could this be cleared away and the rest of the length of that particular part of Mill Lane be checked for any other trees which may present a problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Mill Lane, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet
